main event: A bright object was observed in the sky over Terre Haute, Indiana on August 18, 1959, traveling at an estimated speed of 120,000 miles per hour at an altitude of 120,000 feet.
interesting points: The object was observed to be extremely bright and travel at a very rapid angular velocity, disappearing near the horizon.
A noise resembling 'frying' was heard during the observation of the object.
The observation occurred during the firing of a missile, which may have been detected by the witness.
The Aerospace Technical Intelligence Center concluded the object was likely a bolide or bright meteor, despite the witness's initial report.
The duration of the sighting was estimated to be around 5-6 minutes, longer than a typical meteor event.
result: Likely a bolide or bright meteor, though the exact nature of the object remains unknown.
sighted object: A bright, fast-moving object in the sky
photographs: No photographs present in the report
